intro: Zephyranthes pseudocolchicum, commonly known as the pink rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the late afternoon or evening. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often found in open areas such as coastal dunes, wetlands, and disturbed sites. The flowers are short-lived but attract various pollinators, including moths and beetles.
